submission:
class Solution:
    def largestPalindrome(self, n: int, k: int) -> str:
        
        # for i in range(999, 99, -1):
        #     if str(i) == str(i)[::-1] and i % 6 == 0:
        #         return i
        
        def check(d):
            while len(d) > 5:
                u = d.pop(-1) * 2
                lt = d[-3] * 100 + d[-2] * 10 + d[-1]
                lt -= u
                idx = -1
                while lt:
                    d[idx] = lt % 10
                    idx -= 1
                    lt //= 10
            return int("".join(map(str, d))) % 7 == 0
                
        if k == 1 or k == 3 or k == 9: return "9"*n
        if k == 2 and n > 2: return "8" + "9"*(n-2) + "8"
        elif k == 2: return "8"*n
        if k == 4 and n > 4: return "88" + "9"*(n-4) + "88"
        elif k == 4: return "8"*n
        if k == 5 and n > 2: return "5" + "9"*(n-2) + "5"
        elif k == 5: return "5"*n

        if k == 6 and n == 1: return "6"
        elif k == 6 and n == 2: return "66"
        elif k == 6 and (n & 1): return "8" + "9"*((n-3)//2) + "8" + "9"*((n-3)//2) + "8"
        elif k == 6: return "8" + "9"*((n-4)//2) + "77" + "9"*((n-4)//2) + "8"

        if k == 7 and n == 1: return "7"
        elif k == 7 and n == 2: return "77"
        elif k == 7 and n > 2:
            if n & 1:
                s = (n - 1) // 2
                d = [9]*s + [0] + [9]*s
                for i in range(9, -1, -1):
                    d[s] = i
                    if check(d.copy()): return "".join(map(str, d))
            else:
                s = (n - 2) // 2
                d = [9]*s + [0, 0] + [9]*s
                for i in range(9, -1, -1):
                    d[s], d[s+1] = i, i
                    if check(d.copy()): return "".join(map(str, d))

        if k == 8 and n > 6: return "888" + "9"*(n-6) + "888"
        elif k == 8: return "8"*n
